subject: Re: About JunitReport
msgSnippet: Thanks a lot. I m trying to modify xsl. And I m very appreciating if you can give me some example if you have time off. ... Ant. ... junit- ... file.
messageBody:
Thanks a lot.

I'm trying to modify xsl.

And I'm very appreciating if you can give me some example if you
have time off.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "j_cumps" <j_cumps@...> wrote:
> You have to use your own XSL stylesheet in stead of the ones from
Ant.
>
> If you use the single page report, you need to provide your own
junit-
> noframes.xsl stylesheet.
> If you use the framed report, you need your own junit-frames.xsl.
>
>
> Ant writes all your system and error output to it's TEST-xxx.xml
file.
> But it writes it at testsuite level, not at testmethod level.
>
> If you prefix your output in your tests with
> [testcaseclassname.testmethodname], you can cunningly forge an xls
> stylesheet that only takes output relevant for the current
> testmethod, and write the output to the type column.
>
